value.title: Raleigh police stop using controversial facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: Raleigh police have stopped using a facial recognition app to identify potential criminals through the Internet, cutting ties with a company that has drawn widespread privacy concerns. In August, the department paid $2,500 to Clearview AI for one year’s access to its app, which collects pictures from Facebook, YouTube and other public sites ...

value.title: Met Police rolls out live facial recognition in London
value.excerpt: This is the Met Police’s first live deployment of facial recognition technology in London, following 10 trials around the city since 2016 and months of public debate about the use of the controversial biometric software on the public. The rollout comes in the wake of similar deployments in countries including China, Brazil, India and Wales.
